property.name: templeton.hive.extra.files
property.description: The resources in this list will be localized to the node running LaunchMapper and added to HADOOP_CLASSPTH before launching 'hive' command. If the path /foo/bar is a directory, the contents of the the entire dir will be localized and ./bar/* will be added to HADOOP_CLASSPATH. Note that since classpath path processing does not recurse into subdirectories, the paths in this property may be overlapping. For example, to run Hive on Tez jobs, 3 items need to be localized: /tez-client/conf/tez-site.xml,/tez-client/,/tez-client/lib. In this example, "./tez-site.xml:./tez-client/*:./lib/*" will be added to HADOOP_CLASSPATH. This can be used to specify config files, Tez artifacts, etc. This will be sent -files option of hadoop jar command thus each path is interpreted by Generic Option Parser. It can be local or hdfs path.

property.name: templeton.hive.home
property.description: The path to the Hive home within the tar. This is needed if Hive is not installed on all nodes in the cluster and needs to be shipped to the target node in the cluster to execute Pig job which uses HCat, Hive query, etc. Has no effect if templeton.hive.archive is not set.

property.name: templeton.hcat.home
property.description: The path to the HCat home within the tar. This is needed if Hive is not installed on all nodes in the cluster and needs to be shipped to the target node in the cluster to execute Pig job which uses HCat, Hive query, etc. Has no effect if templeton.hive.archive is not set.

property.name: templeton.hive.properties
property.description: Properties to set when running hive (during job sumission). This is expected to be a comma-separated prop=value list. If some value is itself a comma-separated list the escape character is '\'

property.name: templeton.sqoop.path
property.description: The path to the Sqoop executable.

property.name: templeton.exec.encoding
property.description: The encoding of the stdout and stderr data.

property.name: templeton.exec.timeout
property.description: How long in milliseconds a program is allowed to run on the Templeton box.

property.name: templeton.exec.max-procs
property.description: The maximum number of processes allowed to run at once.

property.name: templeton.exec.max-output-bytes
property.description: The maximum number of bytes from stdout or stderr stored in ram.

property.name: templeton.controller.mr.child.opts
property.description: Java options to be passed to templeton controller map task. The default value of mapreduce child "-Xmx" (heap memory limit) might be close to what is allowed for a map task. Even if templeton controller map task does not need much memory, the jvm (with -server option?) allocates the max memory when it starts. This along with the memory used by pig/hive client it starts can end up exceeding the max memory configured to be allowed for a map task Use this option to set -Xmx to lower value

property.name: templeton.mapper.memory.mb
property.description: Templeton controller job's Launch mapper's memory limit in megabytes. When submitting controller job, Templeton will overwrite mapreduce.map.memory.mb with this value. If empty, Templeton will not set mapreduce.map.memory.mb when submitting the controller job, therefore the configuration in mapred-site.xml will be used.

property.name: templeton.exec.envs
property.description: The environment variables passed through to exec.

property.name: templeton.zookeeper.hosts
property.description: ZooKeeper servers, as comma separated host:port pairs

property.name: templeton.zookeeper.session-timeout

property.name: templeton.callback.retry.interval

property.name: templeton.callback.retry.attempts

property.description: The class to use as storage

property.name: templeton.storage.root

property.name: templeton.hdfs.cleanup.interval
property.description: The maximum delay between a thread's cleanup checks

property.name: templeton.hdfs.cleanup.maxage
property.description: The maximum age of a templeton job

property.name: templeton.zookeeper.cleanup.interval
property.description: The maximum delay between a thread's cleanup checks

property.name: templeton.zookeeper.cleanup.maxage
property.description: The maximum age of a templeton job

property.name: templeton.hadoop.queue.name
property.description: MapReduce queue name where WebHCat map-only jobs will be submitted to. Can be used to avoid a deadlock where all map slots in the cluster are taken over by Templeton launcher tasks.

property.name: templeton.xsrf.filter.enabled
property.description: Enable XSRF protection - looks for the presence of a X-XSRF-HEADER header in all PUT/POST requests, and rejects requests that do not have these.

property.name: templeton.frame.options.filter
property.description: X-Frame-Options is added in HTTP response header with this value to prevent clickjacking attacks. Possible values are DENY, SAMEORIGIN, ALLOW-FROM uri.
